page.title: 16Yorkshire Museum of Farming
page.content: The Yorkshire Farm Machinery Preservation Society were looking for a site for their collection of 800 items of equipment. So with a grant of Â£90,000 the museum was established in August 1980. The site chosen was an open field site, adjacent to the York Livestock Centre. It is close to York the"Heart of Yorkshire",in the centre of three old Ridings of Yorkshire. The museum and surrounding land covering 8 acres was opened 17th July 1982. It aims to attract 500 visitors a day, its maximum attendance has been 1,500. There are large items of farming equipment on display as well as many smaller items, displays of country crafts including weaving and dry-stone walling to try, and a shop selling craft work. There are also animals for the children including 2 donkeys.
